DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Positive Finding Central Nervous System Neoplasm Involvement Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the diagnostic image was positive for central nervous system neoplasm.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Positive Finding Central Nervous System Neoplasm Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Positive Finding Central Nervous System Neoplasm Involvement
Property.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord.  Representative examples of primary neoplasms include astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma, ependymoma, and meningioma.  Representative examples of metastatic neoplasms include carcinoma and leukemia.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
